sentences.text: Who we are
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: John Deere is a world leader in providing advanced products and services and is committed to the success of customers whose work is linked to the land  those who cultivate, harvest, transform, enrich, and build upon the land to meet the worlds dramatically increasing need for food, fuel, shelter, and infrastructure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OUR COMMITMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OUR CORE VALUES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are committed to those linked to the land.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that by serving them we support improving the quality of life for people around the world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through the excellence of our products and services, we help our customers meet two of the biggest challenges in the world: feeding a population growing in size and affluence and developing the infrastructure required to support growing urbanization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In conducting our business, we are guided by four core values that company founder John Deere was known for  integrity, quality, commitment, and innovation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We apply those values in creating our products and services, maintaining our relationships, and operating our factories.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: John Deere, with agricultural and construction equipment businesses, is uniquely positioned to help our customers meet those challenges.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Governance and Compensation Changes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One thing we have learned during our nearly 180-year history is the importance of change, which is why we regularly assess what we do to determine how we can adapt and improve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This approach applies to our corporate governance and compensation plans as much as it does to our manufacturing processes and product innovation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Here is a summary of the changes we have made since our last annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We adopted a by-law in 2016 allowing stockholders meeting certain requirements to nominate directors and have such nominees included in the proxy statement commonly referred to as proxy access.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to 2015, we had received strong stockholder support on the say-on- pay advisory vote, averaging more than 90% approval from 2011 through 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Last year, approximately 61% (71% excluding abstentions) of our stockholders voted in favor of our executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the February 2016 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, we invited our top 20 stockholders to discuss specific governance and compensation matters so we could understand the factors that lead to the decline in the say-on-pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The outreach to stockholders was conducted by Deere management, both in person and by phone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We discussed the most recent revisions to our compensation plans and the proxy access by-law amendments with 17 of our top 20 stockholders, representing about 48% of our then outstanding shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The feedback from these conversations regarding compensation plans was reported to the Compensation Committee and considered in their deliberations on subsequent compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of the feedback received from stockholders, we implemented a number of changes to our compensation program to ensure continued focus on returning value to our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See the Executive Summary of the Compensation Discussion & Analysis (CD&A) for details.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We increased the retirement age for board members to 75 to reflect recent industry trends and to provide stability in the composition of our board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fiscal 2016 Performance Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other highlights include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, Deere & Company sales and earnings were among the 10 best in its history, despite depressed volumes due to the global farm recession and weak construction equipment markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net income attributable to Deere & Company was $1,524 million compared to early fiscal 2016 guidance of $1,400 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adept execution and the impact of a broad product portfolio aided performance while continuing to make progress in establishing a more efficient cost structure, positioning the company well for the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equipment operations benefited from improved price realization and lower production costs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Selling, administrative, and general expenses were reduced by $110 million
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company invested nearly $1.4 billion in research and development
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company completed strategic acquisition of Monosem and secured controlling interest in Hagie Manufacturing Company to expand Deeres agricultural product portfolio
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information regarding our fiscal year 2016 financial performance, please see our Annual Report, which is available at www.proxyvote.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deere returned nearly $1 billion to stockholders in the form of dividends and share repurchases
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Worldwide net sales and revenues decreased 8% in 2016 vs. 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net sales for worldwide Equipment Operations declined 9% in 2016 vs. 2015, which was two points lower than guidance provided to investors early in fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Investors acknowledged the companys ability to operate profitably despite extremely difficult conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share price appreciation plus dividends gave Deere stockholders a total return of about 17% for the year, compared with a gain of about 5% for the overall U.S. equity market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Earnings per share fell 17% vs. 2015, less than the decline in net income*, due to fewer shares outstanding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net income* was down 21% to $1,524 million, though still represented the 10th highest total in our history.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net income exceeded guidance of $1,400 million given to investors early in fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees controlled costs (e.g., reducing selling, administrative, and general costs by almost $100 million) yet still produced award- winning advanced products and services and invested in future growth.

sentences.text: *Net income attributable to Deere & Company

sentences.text: CASH FLOW FROM OPERATING ACTIVITIES (Millions)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consolidated cash flow from  operations totaled a healthy  $3,764 million, essentially the same as the previous year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash flow funded  important projects and paid $761  million in dividends to our investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deere has raised its common stock  dividend 12 times since 2004 and  over that period has returned more  than two-thirds of its consolidated  operating cash flow for dividend  payments and share repurchases  (net of issuances).

sentences.text: PERFORMANCE IN RECENT DOWNTURNS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Equipment Operations are  affected by economic factors such as  prices for commodities and health  of the housing and infrastructure  sectors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2002, we adopted a  strategy that enables management to  quickly respond to changing business  conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During this most recent  downturn our decrease in net income  relative to the decrease in sales is less  severe than we have experienced in  other recent cyclical downturns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NET SALES AND EARNINGS PER SHARE (DILUTED)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2002, Deere has maintained positive diluted EPS performance despite downturns in net sales.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed in the CD&A elsewhere in this proxy, we believe our compensation program contributes to these favorable results by encouraging executives to focus on metrics that create sustained value for stockholders.

sentences.text: Fiscal 2016 Executive Compensation Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation programs and practices are designed to create incentive opportunities for advancing our stockholders long- term interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use metrics that align with our business strategy and motivate our executives to create value for stockholders at all points in the business cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have three separate variable pay components (described below)  Short-Term Incentive (STI), Mid-Term Incentive (MTI) and Long-Term Incentive (LTI)  which stimulate complementary behaviors.

sentences.text: Item 1 - Election of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How We Identify and Evaluate Director Nominees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee of the Board is responsible for screening candidates and recommending director nominees to the full Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board nominates the slate of directors for election at each annual meeting of stockholders, and also elects directors to fill vacancies or newly-created Board seats.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee considers candidates recommended by stockholders, directors, officers, and third-party search firms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you wish to nominate a director, please review the procedures described under 2018 Stockholder Proposals and Nominations on page 86 of this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee evaluates all candidates in the same manner, regardless of the source of the recommendation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deeres Corporate Governance Policies, which are described in the Corporate Governance section o this Proxy Statement, establish the general criteria and framework for assessing director candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, the Corporate Governance Committee considers each nominees skills, experience, international versus domestic background, and age, as well as legal and regulatory requirements and the particular needs of the Board at the time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board assesses the diversity of its members and nominees as part of an annual performance evaluation by considering, among other factors, diversity in expertise, experience, background, ethnicity, and gender.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe a Board composed of members with complementary skills, qualifications, experiences, and attributes is best equipped to satisfy its responsibilities effectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any director who experiences a material change in occupation, career, or principal business activity, including retirement, must tender a resignation from the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon recommendation from the Corporate Governance Committee, the Board may decline to accept any such resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors must retire from the Board upon the first annual meeting of stockholders after reaching the age of 75, except as approved by the Board under rare circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Nominees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee has recommended, and the Board has nominated, each of Samuel R. Allen, Crandall C. Bowles, Vance D. Coffman, Alan C. Heuberger, Dipak C. Jain, Michael O Johanns, Clayton M. Jones, Brian M. Krzanich, Gregory R. Page, Sherry M. Smith, Dmitri L. Stockton, and Sheila G. Talton to be elected for terms expiring at the annual meeting in 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the nominees are current members of the Board, but Deeres Certificate of Incorporation and good governance practices require all members of the Board to be elected annually.

sentences.text: Election of Directors Corporate Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Highlights At Deere, we recognize that good corporate governance contributes to long-term stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are committed to sound governance practices, including those shown below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: INDEPENDENCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BEST PRACTICES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors may not stand for reelection after their 75th birthdays, absent Board approval under rare circumstances
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our director nominees are independent except for our CEO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent Presiding Director has a strong role with significant governance responsibilities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our recoupment policy requires an executive to return any incentive compensation found to have been awarded erroneously due to the accounting misconduct
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All standing Board committees other than the Executive Committee are composed wholly of independent directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors and executives are subject to stock ownership requirements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent directors meet regularly in executive session without management present
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors and executives are prohibited from hedging or pledging their Deere stock
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ACCOUNTABILITY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RISK OVERSIGHT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All directors are elected annually
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board oversees Deeres overall risk management structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In uncontested elections, directors are elected by majority vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual Board committees oversee certain risks related to their specific areas of responsibility
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and each Board committee conducts an annual performance self-evaluation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have robust risk management processes across the company
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders have the ability to include nominees in our proxy statement (so-called proxy access rights)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Values
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At Deere, our actions are guided by our core values of integrity, quality, commitment, and innovation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We strive to live up to these values in everything we donot just because it is good business, but because it is the right thing to do.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are committed to strong corporate governance as a means of upholding these values and ensuring that we are accountable to our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: aThe Board has adopted categorical standards (attached as Appendix A to this Proxy Statement) that help us evaluate each directors independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, these standards are intended to assist the Board in determining whether certain relationships between our directors and Deere or its affiliates are material relationships for purposes of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) independence standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The categorical standards establish thresholds, short of which any such relationships are deemed not to be material.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, each directors independence is evaluated under our Related Person Transactions Approval Policy, as discussed in the Review and Approval of Related Person Transactions section below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deeres independence standards meet or exceed the NYSEs independence requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 15      DEERE & COMPANY          2017 PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Election of Directors Corporate Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In November 2016, we reviewed the independence of each then-sitting director applying the independence standards set forth in our Corporate Governance Policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The reviews considered relationships and transactions between each director (and the directors immediate family and affiliates) and each of Deere, Deeres management, and Deeres independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this review, the Board affirmatively determined at its regular December 2016 meeting that no director other than Mr. Allen has a material relationship with Deere and its affiliates and that each director other than Mr. Allen is independent as defined in our Corporate Governance Policies and the NYSEs listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Allen is not an independent director because of his employment relationship with Deere.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman of the Board also serves as Deeres Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that combining the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer roles is the most appropriate structure for Deere at this time for three reasons:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This structure has served our stockholders well through many economic cycles, business challenges, and leadership successions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. The Boards governance processes preserve Board independence by ensuring discussion among independent directors and independent evaluation of and communication with members of senior management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. The enhanced role of the independent Presiding Director provides a strong counterbalance to the combined Chairman and Chief Executive Officer roles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Presiding Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vance D. Coffman has served as our independent Presiding Director since the 2016 annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Presiding Director is elected by a majority of the independent directors upon a recommendation from the Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Presiding Director is appointed for a one-year term beginning upon election and expiring upon the selection of a successor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has assigned the Presiding Director the following duties and responsibilities:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Preside at all meetings of the Board at which the Chairman is not present, including executive sessions of the independent directo
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Serve as liaison between the Chairman and the independent directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In consultation with the Chairman, review and approve the schedule of meetings of the Board, the proposed agendas, and the materials to be sent to the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Call meetings of the independent directors when necessary; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Remain available for consultation and direct communication with Deeres stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes the role of the Presiding Director exemplifies Deeres continuing commitment to strong corporate governance and Board independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Meetings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under Deeres by-laws, regular meetings of the Board are held at least quarterly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our typical practice is to schedule at least one Board meeting per year at a company location other than our World Headquarters so directors have an opportunity to observe different aspects of our business first-hand.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board met five times during fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are expected to attend Board meetings, meetings of committees on which they serve, and stockholder meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More to the point, directors are expected to spend the time needed and meet as frequently as necessary to properly discharge their responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal 2016, all incumbent directors attended 75% or more of the meetings of the Board and committees on which they served.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overall attendance at Board and committee meetings was 100%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All directors then in office attended the Annual Meeting of Stockholders in February 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Board meeting normally begins or ends with a session between the CEO and the independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This provides a platform for discussions outside the presence of the non-Board management attendees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent directors may meet in executive session, without the CEO, at any time, but such non-management executive sessions are scheduled (and typically occur) at each regular Board meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Presiding Director presides over these executive sessions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Committees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has delegated some of its authority to five committees: the Executive Committee, the Audit Review Committee, the Compensation Committee, the Corporate Governance Committee, and the Finance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Finance Committee, which replaced the Pension Plan Oversight Committee in February 2016, focuses and enhances the Boards oversight of Deeres financial affairs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to creating a new committee, the Board approved the rotation of certain directors committee memberships effective February 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that committee rotation is generally desirable to ensure that committees regularly benefit from new perspectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of our Board committees has adopted a charter that complies with current NYSE rules relating to corporate governance matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Copies of the committee charters are available at www.deere.com/corpgov and may also be obtained upon request to the Deere & Company Stockholder Relations Department.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each committee (other than the Executive Committee, which did not meet in 2016 and of which Mr. Allen serves as chair) is composed solely of independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee structure and memberships described below reflect the changes that became effective in February 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Every committee other than the Executive Committee regularly reports on its activities to the full Board.

sentences.text: Board Oversight of Risk Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that strong and effective internal controls and risk management processes are essential for achieving long-term stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board, directly and through its committees, is responsible for overseeing risks that may affect Deere.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RISK MANAGEMENT APPROACH
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain a structured risk management approach to facilitate our strategic business objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To that end, we identify and categorize risks, and then escalate them as needed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our internal risk management structure is administered by a Management Risk Committee consisting of the CEO and his direct reports.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This committee provides periodic reports to the Board regarding Deeres risk management processes and reviews with the Board high-priority areas of enterprise risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dedicated risk management reports typically take place at regularly-scheduled Board meetings each February and August, and risk management topics are discussed as needed at other Board and committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BOARD AND COMMITTEE RISK OVERSIGHT RESPONSIBILITIES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Board committee is responsible for oversight of risk categories related to the committees specific area of focus, while the full Board exercises ultimate responsibility for overseeing the risk management function as a whole.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The areas of risk oversight exercised by the Board and its committees are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who is responsible?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Primary areas of risk oversight Full Board Oversees overall risk management function, and regularly receives and evaluates reports and presentations from the chairs of the individual Board committees on risk-related matters falling within each committees oversight responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Review Committee Monitors operational, strategic, and legal and regulatory risks by regularly reviewing reports and presentations given by management, including our Senior Vice President and General Counsel, Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, and Vice President, Internal Audit, as well as other operational personnel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regularly reviews our risk management practices and risk-related policies (for example, Deeres risk management and insurance portfolio, and legal and regulatory reviews) and evaluates potential risks related to internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee Monitors potential risks related to the design and administration of our compensation plans, policies, and programs, including our performance-based compensation programs, to promote appropriate incentives that do not encourage executive officers or employees to take unnecessary and excessive risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Committee Monitors potential risks related to our governance practices by, among other things, reviewing succession plans and performance evaluations of the Board and CEO, monitoring legal developments and trends regarding corporate governance practices, the Code of Business Conduct and evaluating potential related person transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Monitors risks relating to environmental factors, as well as product safety and other compliance matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finance Committee Monitors operational and strategic risks related to Deeres financial affairs, including capital structure and liquidity risks, and reviews the policies and strategies for managing financial exposure and contingent liabilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Monitors potential risks related to funding our U.S. qualified pension plans (other than the defined contribution savings and investment plans) and monitors compliance with applicable laws and internal policies and objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Outreach
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to ensure the continued delivery of sustainable, long-term value to our stockholders, we engage in regular dialogue with our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, we discussed governance, executive compensation, and other issues with stockholders representing more than 48% of our outstanding shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board considers feedback from these conversations during its deliberations, and we regularly review and adjust our corporate governance structure and executive compensation policies and practices in response to comments from our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Secretary will submit your correspondence to the Board or the appropriate committee, as applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have structured the compensation of our nonemployee directors with the following objectives in mind:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recognize the substantial investment of time and expertise necessary for the directors to discharge their duties to oversee Deeres global affairs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Align the directors interests with the long-term interests of our stockholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ensure that compensation is easy to understand and is regarded positively by our stockholders and employe
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We pay nonemployee directors an annual retainer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, committee chairpersons and the Presiding Director receive fees for assuming those responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors who are employees receive no additional compensation for serving on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not pay committee member retainers or meeting fees, but we do reimburse directors for expenses related to meeting attendance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To supplement their cash compensation and align their interests with those of our stockholders, nonemployee directors are awarded restricted stock units (RSUs) after each annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A person who serves a partial term as a nonemployee director will receive a prorated retainer and a prorated RSU award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation for nonemployee directors is reviewed annually by the Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At its December 2016 meeting, the Board approved increases as noted below for nonemployee directors as recommended by the Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cash components became effective on January 1, 2017 and the equity component is effective for the equity award following the annual stockholder meeting in February 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following chart describes amounts we pay and the value of awards we grant to nonemployee directors:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Date Approved by Corporate Governance Committee: Effective Date of Annual Amounts:       August2013 January 2014      December2016 January & March 2017 Retainer       $120,000 $125,000 Equity Award $120,000 $145,000 Presiding Director Fee $ 20,000   $ 25,000 Audit Review Committee Chair Fee $ 20,000 $ 25,000 Compensation Committee Chair Fee $ 20,000 $ 20,000 Corporate Governance Committee Chair Fee $ 15,000 $ 15,000 Finance Committee Chair Fee $ 15,000 $ 15,000
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our Nonemployee Director Deferred Compensation Plan, directors may choose to defer some or all of their annual retainers until hey retire from the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For deferral elections up through December 2016, a director could elect to have these deferrals invested in either an interest-bearing account or an account with a return equivalent to an investment in Deere common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For deferrals effective n January 2017 and later, directors may choose from a list of investment options, none of which yield an above-market earnings rate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stock ownership guidelines require each nonemployee director to own Deere common stock equivalent in value to at least three times the directors annual cash retainer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This ownership level must be achieved within five years of the date the director joins the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted shares (regularly granted to nonemployee directors prior to 2008), RSUs, and any common stock held personally by the nonemployee director are included in determining whether the applicable ownership threshold has been reached.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other than Mr. Johanns, Mr. Stockton, and Ms. Talton, who were first elected to the Board in 2015, and Mr. Krzanich and Mr. Heuberger, who were first elected to the Board in January and December of 2016, respectively, each nonemployee director has achieved stockholdings in excess of the applicable multiple as of the date of this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review and Approval of Related Person Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted a Related Person Transactions Approval Policy, which assigns our Corporate Governance Committee the responsibility for reviewing, approving, or ratifying all related person transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Related Person Transactions Approval Policy is concerned with three types of related persons:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) executive officers and directors of Deere
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) any holder of 5% or more of Deeres voting securities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) immediate family members of anyone in category (1) or (2)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, our directors and executive officers complete questionnaires designed to elicit information about potential related person transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the directors and officers must promptly advise our Corporate Secretary if there are any changes to the information they previously provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After consultation with our General Counsel, management, and outside counsel, as appropriate, our Corporate Secretary determines whether any transaction is reasonably likely to be a related person transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transactions deemed reasonably likely to be related person transactions are submitted to the Corporate Governance Committee for consideration at its next meeting, unless action is required sooner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In such a case, the transaction would be submitted to the Chairperson of the Corporate Governance Committee, whose determination would be reported to the full committee at its next meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When evaluating potential related person transactions, the Corporate Governance Committee or its Chairperson, as applicable, considers all reasonably available relevant facts and circumstances and approves only those related person transactions determined in good faith to be in compliance with or not inconsistent with our Code of Ethics and Code of Business Conduct, and in the best interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (the Exchange Act) and related regulations require our directors, certain of our officers, and persons who own more than 10% of a registered class of our equity securities to file reports of ownership and changes in ownership with the SEC and to provide copies of those reports to Deere.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To assist with these required reports, we have established procedures whereby directors and officers provide us with the relevant information regarding their transactions in Deere shares and we prepare and file the ownership reports on their behalf.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our directors and officers have provided written statements regarding their Deere stock ownership and reports.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based solely upon a review of these statements and reports, we believe that all Section 16(a) filing requirements applicable to our insiders were complied with during fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 2  Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with Section 14A of the Exchange Act, we are asking our stockholders to approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of the executives named in the Summary Compensation Table of this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deeres practice, which was approved by our stockholders at the 2011 annual meeting, is to conduct this non-binding vote annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Supporting Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deeres compensation philosophy is to pay for performance, support Deeres business strategies, and offer competitive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation programs consist of complementary elements that reward achievement of both short-term and long-term objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The metrics used for our incentive programs are either associated with operating performance or are based upon a function of Deeres stock price with linkage to revenue growth and total shareholder return (TSR).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Review of Pay for Performance Relative to Peer Group (see page 37) in the CD&A, which highlights our success in aligning executive compensation with Deeres financial performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROGRAM DESIGN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROGRAM DESIGN The CD&A offers a detailed description of our compensation programs and philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation approach is supported by the following principles, among others, as fully described in the CD&A:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We strive to attract, retain, and motivate high-caliber executives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As executives assume more responsibility, we increase the portion of their total compensation that is at-risk and that is tied to long-term incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We recognize the cyclical nature of our equipment businesses and the need to manage value throughout the business cycle
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide opportunities for NEOs to be long-term stockholders of Deere
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We structure our compensation program to be regarded positively by our stockholders and employees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2016 Annual Meeting, we held a stockholder advisory vote on executive compensation in which stockholders approved the advisory vote on the compensation of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, in our evaluation of our executive compensation program in light of the percentage vote received in 2016 and in response to our stockholder feedback initiative following the 2016 Annual Meeting, the Compensation Committee took several actions to enhance the program by making the changes discussed in the CD&A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that the executive compensation as disclosed in the CD&A, the accompanying tables, and other disclosures in this Proxy Statement is consistent with our compensation philosophy and aligns with the pay practices of our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR THE REASONS STATED, THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECOMMENDS THAT YOU VOTE FOR THE FOLLOWING NON- BINDING RESOLUTION:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the stockholders approve the compensation of the NEOs as disclosed in this Proxy Statement pursuant to the compensation disclosure rules of the SEC, including the CD&A, tabular disclosures, and other narrative executive compensation disclosures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effect of Proposal
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The say-on-pay resolution is non-binding, but the Board values your opinion as expressed through your votes and other communications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the Board and the Compensation Committee will carefully consider the outcome of the advisory vote and those opinions when making future compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Board believes that the Compensation Committee is in the best position to consider the extensive information and factors necessary to make independent, objective, and competitive compensation recommendations and decisions that are in the best interests of Deere and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thus, the final decision regarding the compensation and benefits of our executive officers, and whether and how to address stockholder concerns, remains with the Board and the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion & Analysis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this section, we provide a detailed description of our compensation programs, including the underlying philosophy and strategy, the individual elements, the methodology and processes used by the Board and the Compensation Committee (the Committee) to make compensation decisions, and the relationship between Deeres performance and compensation delivered in fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The discussion in this CD&A focuses on the compensation of our CEO, CFO, and the next three most highly compensated executive officers for the fiscal year ended October 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These individuals, referred to as Deeres named executive officers (or NEOs), were:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Name      Title Samuel R. Allen Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Rajesh Kalathur   Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer James M. Field President, Agricultural Equipment Operations Michael J. Mack Jr.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * Group President, John Deere Financial Services, Global Human Resources, and Public Affairs John C. May President, Agricultural Solutions and Chief Information Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: *Mr.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mack retired effective November 1, 2016.

sentences.text: 28      DEERE & COMPANY          2017 PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our business strategy emphasizes superior financial performance: maintaining aggressive goals for operating margin and asset turns and realizing sustainable Shareholder Value Added growth through disciplined expansion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deeres compensation program is designed to motivate NEOs to execute this strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, despite a global farm recession and weak construction equipment markets, we achieved net sales & revenue ($26,644 million) and net income ($1,524 million) that are among the 10 best in Deere & Companys history.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These results reflect the success of our strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees controlled costs (e.g., reducing selling, administrative, and general costs by almost $100 million) and increased the productivity of our assets, yet still produced award-winning advanced products and services and invested in future growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The results also reflect the benefits of our broad business lineup  including smaller tractors, turf equipment, forestry products, and service parts, as well as Financial Services  which partially offset continuing weakness in the agricultural and construction markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since aligning the metrics of our compensation program with our strategy in 2002, we have operated profitably at every point in the business cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Snapshot of Compensation Elements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The components of our 2016 compensation program are as follows
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total Direct Compensation Total Indirect Compensation Short-Term Compensation Long-Term Compensation Other Compensation and Benefits Base Salary STI MTI LTI Fixed cash component Annual cash award for profitability and efficient operations during the fiscal year Cash award for sustained profitable growth during a three- year period Equity award for creating stockholder value as reflected by Deeres stock price, revenue growth, and TSR Perquisites; retirement benefits;deferred compensation benefits;additional benefits payable upon a change in control   Metrics: Operating Return on Operating Assets (OROA) & Return On Equity (ROE)* Metric:  Shareholder Value Added (SVA) Metrics:  Revenue Growth & Total Shareholder Return
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: *The Equipment Operations OROA calculation excludes the assets from our captive financial services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ROE is based solely on the Financial Services segment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See appendix B for details.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our incentive program design reflects the long-term, cyclical nature of our industry and provides a framework for both executive and broad-based, non-executive programs to ensure that all employees pursue the same financial and operational goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The STI drives focus on near-term results, while a two-tiered long-term incentive programMTI and LTIreward growth and sustainable profitability over a longer period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Introduced in 2004, the cash-based MTI rewards sustained profitable growth and replaced an equity program that was costly and dilutive to stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MTI differs from LTI in that it motivates actionable behavior for long- term profitability and asset management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given the long-term, cyclical nature of our industry, the STI and MTI metrics create different, yet complementary, incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the years since the Board adopted these two incentive plans, we have demonstrated the ability to manage through various business and market conditions more profitably and to consistently generate operating cash flow, (especially as compared to peer group companies; see the OROA chart on page 42 and the Return on Invested Capital (ROIC) chart on page 51.) The current combination of cash- and equity-based long-term compensation reflects the current peer group practice with about 50% maintaining a similar mix.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents

sentences.text: Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To align compensation with our business strategy of exceptional operating performance, we historically have used OROA and ROE as the metrics for our STI plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These metrics are designed to inspire the efficient use of assets and capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: STI goals are determined each year based on where we are in the business cycle to ensure that goals are uniformly challenging in all economic conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning in fiscal 2017, we will use two additional metricsnet sales & revenue and net incometo determine STI awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These new metrics reflect the importance of near-term financial execution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To align compensation with disciplined growth, we use SVA as the metric for our MTI plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SVA measures our success in delivering sustained growth in economic profitability over a three-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To align compensation with exceptional equity appreciation and to motivate and reward sustained outperformance, our Long- Term Incentive (LTI) plan uses stock options and restricted stock units (RSUs), whose ultimate values are tied to Deeres stock price, and performance stock units (PSUs), which are earned (or not) based on Deeres relative revenue growth and TSR as compared to the S&P Industrial Sector.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Here are some of the key drivers that affect the STI, MTI and LTI metrics on a short and long-term basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DRIVERS OF ONE-YEAR  DRIVERS OF THREE-YEAR  DRIVERS OF REVENUE OROA AND ROE (STI)  SVA (MTI)  GROWTH AND TSR (LTI)  Operating cost management  Disciplined asset management  Efficient use of equity  Near-term business execution  Cost management decisions with a long-term focus  Efficient use of long-term assets  Long-term investment decisions for capital and R&D  World-class distribution systems  Technology innovation  Market conditions  Market share  Successful execution of business strategy  Stock price appreciation over the long-term
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Financial Performance and Compensation Metrics
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As outlined above, the metrics Deere uses to measure success in its business strategy are the same used in our compensation programs to ensure that employees are working as a high-performance team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further details below illustrate how the companys compensation plans are sensitive to fluctuations in business conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, payouts for STI and MTI are significantly ower for 2016 than for 2015, in line with lower metric outcomes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the payouts are above target, reflecting the level of difficulty in achieving the results during severe, extended downturns in global agricultural and construction markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deeres goals for OROA remain above those of its major competitors.

sentences.text: After our fiscal 2016 earnings release on November 23, 2016, our investors recognized this performance and our stock price increased to $100.20 as of November 30, 2016a 13% increase that was sustained through the end of December 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Outreach
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to 2016, we consistently received strong stockholder support on the say-on-pay advisory vote, averaging more than 90% approval from 2011 through 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, approximately 61% (71% excluding abstentions) of our stockholders voted in favor of our executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the 2016 annual meeting, we invited our top 20 stockholders to participate in discussions regarding our executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During June to August, we met with 17 of our top 20 stockholders, representing about 48% of our then outstanding shares to discuss specific governance and compensation matters to better understand what drove the decline in the say-on-pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The outreach was conducted by senior members of Human Resources (HR), including the then President and Vice President of HR, Investor Relations and Legal, both in person and by phone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We discussed our approach to executive compensation programs, stockholder views on the program design and the most recent revisions to our compensation plans and he proxy access by-law amendments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Here are some things we learned during these meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WHAT WE HEARD
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOW WE RESPONDED
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To further reinforce the alignment of the incentive programs with the cyclical nature of our business, the Committee revised our STI and MTI programs as described in this chart and detailed under Recent Changes to Deeres Executive Compensation Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Most stockholders understand the cyclicality of our business and that one- or three-year TSR may not align to operating performance for any one given year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As long-term stockholders, they believe the STI and MTI metrics motivate employees to focus on actions and decisions within our control regardless of varied and changing business conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Performance in Recent Downturns graph in the Proxy Summary demonstrates that Deere has performed much better in this downturn compared to those in the past.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this success is due to the employees deep understanding of OROA, ROE and SVA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These will continue to be the primary metrics for our STI and MTI programs, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stockholders understand how OROA, ROE and SVA are linked to successful operating performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They believe the STI and MTI programs and associated financial metrics contribute to successful operating performance, drive the right employee behavior, provide long-term focus, and promote the creation of long-term value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: STI:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: STI:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Maximum or near-maximum STI payouts in most of the recent fiscal years is not typical as compared to other companies, especially given the recent downturn in Deeres business conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders generally agreed it was appropriate to increase OROA goals based on improved performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In last years proxy, we announced higher OROA goals for 2016, primarily at mid-cycle and the peak of the business cycle to incentivize additional improvements in our operating performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To further enhance the rigor of the performance goals, the Committee increased OROA goals for 2017 at the trough and mid- cycle of the business cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These increased OROA goals were applied to the NEOs beginning in fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cumulative increases to OROA goals since 2015 are as follows (see details on page 43):
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that additional metrics linked to our annual business plan would reflect the importance of near-term financial execution and foster accountability to short-term results.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They believe Deere has strong alignment between business strategy and compensation design, though our proxy statements have not demonstrated that connection.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee regularly reviews our compensation programs and strives to enhance the connection with both company performance and stockholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To that end, based upon feedback from our stockholders (obtained after the annual meeting) and in consultation with our independent compensation consultant, the Committee has adopted several changes to Deeres executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The table below summarizes those changes and indicates where you can find a complete discussion.

sentences.text: Compensation Element Description of change Pageto find  more information STI Fiscal 2016: Increased goals for OROA, one of the two metrics for Deeres STI, from the mid-cycle to the peak of the business cycle.

sentences.text: Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation 2016 Compensation Overview
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Compensation Overview
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deere is committed to a longstanding compensation philosophy that incorporates the principles of paying for performance, supporting business strategies, and paying competitively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes this philosophy continues to drive our NEOs and salaried employees to produce sustainable, positive results for Deere and our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Snapshot of Compensation Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To ensure that our compensation program meets Deeres business objectives without compromising our core values, we regularly compare our compensation practices and governance against market best practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Here are some of the best practices we have implemented.

sentences.text: Compensation Elements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary elements of our compensation program are summarized in the table below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Component      Purpose      Characteristics      Fiscal 2016 Actions and Results Base salary Based on level of responsibility, experience, and sustained individual performance Fixed cash component generally targeted at the peer group median Mr. Allen did not receive an increase to base salary for 2016; the other NEOs received increases of 3-12% based on market median Short-Term Incentive (STI)   Reward for achieving higher profitability through operating efficiencies and asset management during the fiscal year   Awarded in cash, a target STI award is designed to contribute to annual cash compensation and overall compensation at the peer group median Due to continued strong OROA and ROE results, the STI payout was 137% of target, resulting in an award of $2.6 million for the CEO and awards ranging from $0.7 million to $0.8 million for the other NEOs Mid-Term Incentive (MTI) Reward for achieving sustained profitable growth over a three-year performance period Awarded in cash, a target MTI award is designed to contribute to overall compensation at the peer group median The MTI payout declined from 200% in fiscal 2015 to 106% of target in fiscal 2016, resulting in an MTI award of $1.9 million for the CEO and awards of approximately $0.6 million each for the other NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentive (LTI) Reward for creating stockholder value   Awarded in a combination of PSUs, RSUs, and stock options, a base-level LTI award is designed to contribute to overall compensation at the peer group median; LTI awards can be increased by up to 20% to recognize individual performance   In December 2015, the CEO received an LTI award valued at $8.4 million, a 10% increase over the base-level award; LTI awards for the other NEOs were increased an average of 8% ranging from $1.5 to $1.7 million; adjustments reflect strong operating performance and rapid response to challenging business conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Perquisites Provide our executives with benefits comparable to those provided to executives at our peer group companies Benefits like medical exams and financial planning services that personally benefit the employee, are not related to job performance, and are available to a select group of employees There were no changes to perquisites in fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We modified the investment options available under deferred compensation plans to ensure participants cannot earn abovemarket returns on new deferrals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement benefits Provide income upon retirement Defined benefit pension plans plus a 401(k) plan with a variable company match There were no changes to retirement benefits in fiscal 2016.

sentences.text: Pay for performance is an essential element of our compensation philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe compensation should motivate our executives to substantially contributeboth individually and collaborativelyto Deeres long-term, sustainable growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To that end, our performance- based compensation program consists of three components (STI, MTI, and LTI), all driven by metrics that align with Deeres business strategy and reflect the cyclical nature of the industries in which Deere operates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To enhance the connection between pay and performance, as our NEOs assume greater responsibility, we award a larger portion of their total compensation in the form of at risk incentive awards, and a larger portion of their incentive awards in the form of equity.

sentences.text: Compensation Methodology and Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Review and Approval of Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is responsible for reviewing and approving goals and objectives related to incentive compensation for the majority of salaried employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, the Committee evaluates the NEOs performance in relation to established goals and ultimately approves compensation for the NEOs (except for the CEO).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All substantive responsibilities related to the compensation of the NEOs are undertaken exclusively by the members of the Committee, all of whom are independent under current NYSE listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee periodically reviews the components of our compensation program to ensure the program is aligned with our business strategy, Deeres performance, and the interests of our employees and stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee regularly reviews market practices for all significant elements of executive compensation and approves necessary adjustments to ensure Deere remains competitive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Methodology and Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, at the Board meeting in August, the full Board (in executive session without the CEO present) evaluates the CEOs performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considers the results of that evaluation when providing recommendations to the independent members of the Board for the CEOs compensation, which they then approve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO does not play a role in, and is not present during, discussions regarding his own compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO plays a significant role in setting the compensation for the other NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Committee meeting in December, the CEO evaluates each NEOs individual performance, and also recommends changes to the NEOs base salaries and LTI awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (The CEO is not involved in setting the STI and MTI awards because they are calculated using predetermined factors.)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has the discretion to accept, reject, or modify the CEOs recommendations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Role of the Compensation Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has retained Pearl Meyer, LLC (Pearl Meyer) as its compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pearl Meyer reviews our executive compensation program design and assesses our compensation approach relative to our performance and the market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has sole responsibility for setting and modifying the fees paid to Pearl Meyer, determining the nature and scope of its services, evaluating its performance, and can terminate Pearl Meyers engagement or hire another compensation consultant at any time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pearl Meyer periodically meets independently with the Chair of the Committee, and regularly participates in executive sessions with the Committee (without any Deere personnel or executives present) to review compensation data and discuss compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Committee values this expert advice, ultimately the Committees decisions reflect many factors and considerations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management works with Pearl Meyer at the Committees direction to develop materials and analysis, such as competitive market assessments and summaries of current legal and regulatory developments, which are essential to the Committees compensation determinations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal 2016, Pearl Meyer performed the following specific services:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provided information on executive compensation trends and external developments, including regulatory changes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provided a competitive evaluation of total compensation for the NEOs, as well as overall compensation program share usage, dilution and LTI expense
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewed the peer group used for market analyses
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewed the competitiveness of actual pay delivered in relation to performance as compared against the peer group, as further discussed below
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provided recommendations on CEO total compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewed our CEOs compensation recommendations with respect to the other NEOs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewed Committee agendas and supporting materials in advance of each meeting, and raised questions or issues wit management and the Committee Chair, as appropriate
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provided guidance and recommendations on incentive plan design, including rigor of metrics and goals
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewed drafts and commented on this CD&A and the related compensation tables
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pearl Meyer does not provide other significant services to Deere and has no other direct or indirect business relationships with Deere or any of its affiliates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Taking these and other factors into account, the Committee has determined that the work performed by Pearl Meyer does not raise any conflicts of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, based on its analysis of the factors identified in the Committees charter as being relevant to compensation consultant independence, the Committee has concluded that Pearl Meyer is independent of Deeres management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The analysis, as shown in the graphs below, reveals that realizable pay for Deeres CEO and Other NEOs was reasonably aligned with Deeres relative TSR over the relevant time period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deere had the second lowest TSR in the peer group, and our NEOs realizable pay levels were between the 25th and 50th percentiles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on these results and the results of similar past comparisons of pay and performance alignment, we believe our pay programs ensure that compensation for our executives is aligned with performance and market norms.

sentences.text: Total realizable pay for Deeres NEOs is defined as the sum of the following components:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. Actual STI awards paid over the three-year period

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN
