sentences.text: Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation Direct Compensation Elements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Direct Compensation Elements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following information describes each direct compensation element, including the applicable performance metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining salary levels for each of our NEOs, the Committee considers factors such as the financial and operational performance, leadership, development of people, time in position, internal equity, and potential.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also considers each NEOs current salary as compared to the salary range and median salary practices of our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After considering all relevant information, the Board determined that the CEOs base salary for fiscal 2016 should remain unchanged.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The other NEOs received increases ranging from 3% to 12%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Kalathur and Mr. May received higher-than-average increases because their base salaries have been significantly below market since they became senior officers in 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEOs salary levels remain below the market median for similar positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Short-Term Incentive (STI)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PERFORMANCE METRICS FOR STI
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that operating margins and efficient deployment of Deeres assets (both fixed and working capital) are key drivers in creating long-term stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For this reason, the Committee has designed the STI program to motivate Deeres executives and most other salaried employees to focus on reducing costs and optimizing asset and capital efficiency no matter where we are in the business cycle each fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By consistently managing OROA results through all points in the business cycle, Deere has been able to return more than two-thirds of cash flow from our operations to investors through dividends and net share repurchases since 2004.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal 2016, we used two distinct metrics to motivate employees; reflecting key differences between our manufacturing and financing businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the two businesses that make up our Equipment Operations segment Agriculture and Turf Operations and Construction and Forestry Operationsthe metric is OROA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For our Financial Services segment, the metric is ROE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described below, the performance results for these metrics are combined to determine STI awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, the various business results were weighted to calculate STI as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equipment Operations OROA 50% Agriculture and Turf Operations OROA 25% Construction and Forestry Operations OROA 15% Financial Services ROE 10%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The emphasis on the OROA performance of the Equipment Operations and its constituent divisions in calculating STI reflects the critical position these operations have as drivers of Deeres business: Equipment Operations net sales accounted for 89% of Deeres net sales & revenues in fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 50% weighting for the combined Equipment Operations reflects the importance of employees aligning with the overall business strategies and not optimizing within a business segment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We explain the metrics and the reasons behind them in this section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can see how OROA and ROE were calculated for fiscal 2016 in Appendix B, Deere & Company Reconciliation of Non-GAAP Measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 39      DEERE & COMPANY          2017 PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation Direct Compensation Elements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OROA
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deere is primarily a manufacturing company with high investment in fixed assets, such as buildings and machinery, and significant expenses with longer term payoffs, such as research and development.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the past few decades, Deeres Equipment Operations businesses have weathered many business cycles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among other things, this segment is affected by economic factors such as prices for commodities (like corn and other crops) and the health of the housing and infrastructure sectors because we make the equipment that farmers and contractors rely on.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When commodity prices are low or the housing and infrastructure sectors are weak, our customers delay equipment purchases and upgrades.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n 2004, Deere adopted a strategy designed to enable management to respond quickly and purposefully to changing business conditions n order to drive sustained operational results across volatile business cycles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A focus on OROA performance was, and continues to be, a key component of this strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes OROA effectively measures the efficient use of the Equipment Operations assets and the ability to manage operating margins under varying business conditions, and is an appropriate metric for STI awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Using OROA as an STI performance metric aligns employee decisions with our strategic approach to sound investment of capital and asset utilization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because business conditions can quickly change, the Committee sets a range of OROA goals for a range of potential conditions rather than for a static forecast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This allows us to be agile and encourages us to prepare in advance for a variety of business conditions so we are ready for any scenario.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Foundational to understanding how we determine the OROA goals for a given fiscal year is the concept of mid-cycle sales.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We calculate mid-cycle sales annually by gathering historical information on the size of the industry (for example, the total number of tractors sold in the U.S. market) and Deeres market share for every product line (in this example, the number of tractors sold by Deere).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This nformation helps us understand the cyclical nature, from peak to trough, of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mid-cycle sales are determined for each product line which could be in varying business cycles within the same performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This allows us to set meaningful operating performance goals at the product line level while maintaining a unified incentive program for the salaried employee population.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For most of our Agricultural and Turf products, a typical business cycle is around seven years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the Construction and Forestry products, the cycle tends to be a bit shorter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As shown in the graph below, we use that historical information to determine mid-cycle sales essentially our best estimate of what normal looks like.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WHAT IS MID-CYCLE?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally speaking, at the peak of a typical business cycle, actual sales constitute 120% of mid-cycle sales; at the trough, actual sales constitute 80% of mid-cycle sales.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OROA goals vary each year to reflect where we are on this spectrum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have relied on the process of analyzing mid-cycle sales for decades to make decisions related to measuring the achievement of long-term business strategies, allocating manufacturing capacity and workforce, and determining standard costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mid-cycle goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee first established OROA goals for STI purposes by comparing Deeres OROA performance to that of the companies in the peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The median OROA for the peer group is in the range of 10-15% (see OROA Deere vs. Peers 1997-2016 on next page).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, Deeres original target OROA at mid-cycle (the normal part of a business cycle) was set at 12%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: That goal provided a reasonable approximation of Deeres cost of capital, and aligned with our compensation strategy of awarding median pay for median performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee then set OROA goals for threshold and maximum
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 40      DEERE & COMPANY          2017 PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation Direct Compensation Elements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: STI payouts at mid-cycle to approximate 25th and 75th percentile performance, respectively, relative to the peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has reviewed and approved the goals each year but because peer group OROA performance has essentially remained consistent, the OROA goals at mid-cycle also remained unchanged until recently, as discussed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The OROA goals are the same for Equipment Operations, Agriculture & Turf Operations and Construction and Forestry Operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Goals for peak and trough conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To maintain the rigor of the program, the Committee cannot just set goals for  mid-cycle, normal conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If OROA goals were consistent regardless of where we are in a business cycle, our employees would be unduly rewarded when the economy is strong and penalized for poor economic conditions that have a ripple effect on our sales.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thus, the Committee fixes threshold, target, and maximum OROA goals that are more ambitious at the peak  of a business cycle, when it is easier to cover fixed costs and achieve a high asset turnover (and thus a better OROA), and less ambitious at the trough.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This model encourages us to quickly make necessary structural changes, such as those related to cost reduction, capacity, and assets (especially inventory), as business conditions change during the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As shown in the following graph, the goals for a given year are determined based on where we are in the business cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How do OROA goals work?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For an example of how our multi-tiered OROA goals work in practice, assume we determined that mid-cycle sales are  $30 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If actual sales for the year are $27 billion, that means we are at 90% of mid-cycle (27  30 = .90).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In that case,  OROA goals would be lower than the goals for mid-cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On the other hand, if actual sales are $33 billion, that means  we are at 110% of mid-cycle (33  30 =1.1).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In that case, OROA goals would be greater than the goals for mid-cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both scenarios are illustrated below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXAMPLE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recent changes in the OROA goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the years since we adopted OROA as an enterprise-wide performance metric, Deere has significantly restructured its Equipment Operations to enable more rapid responses to changing business conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, for over a decade Deeres OROA results have consistently outpaced the peer group, as depicted in the following graph.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OROA DEERE VS. PEERS 19972016*
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: *Peer group data for 2016 is not yet available.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OROA calculations for Deere and the peers exclude assets for any captive financial services (if applicable).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The products we sell are subject to cycles that differ from our peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To put these cycles in perspective, the table shows our OROA and net sales over this same period of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Note that since the adoption of OROA as an enterprise-wide metric in 2004, our OROA performance has exceeded the peer group even we experienced volatile business conditions (as indicated by net sales):
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deeres sustained success in delivering OROA performance under varying business conditions has resulted in maximum or near- maximum STI payouts in recent fiscal years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To further incentivize stronger operational performance and seize the benefits of Deeres structural transformation, the Committee recently raised OROA goals for STI purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making this decision, the Committee determined that we should no longer set Deeres OROA goals solely by looking at our performance relative to the peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, the Committee believes Deere should be measured relative to its own capabilities and aspirations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For this reason, the OROA goals in effect beginning with fiscal 2016 were significantly more rigorous at mid-cycle and peak than they have been in the past, as shown in the chart on the following page.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee made only minor increases to the goals at trough since our experience at that part of the business cycle was limited and had not yet proven to be sustainable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ROE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ROE is the STI performance metric for Financial Services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Financial Services business is a key differentiator for how Deere delivers value to our dealers and customers, so we think it is important to consider Financial Services performance as part of STI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes ROE effectively measures the efficient use of the segments equity and it is commonly used in the financial services industry for that purpose.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have two distinct business models within Financial Services, and we use different ROE goals for each.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Historically, approximately 65% of Financial Services business is subsidized.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the subsidized business model, the Equipment Operations provide subsidies to Financial Services to reduce the interest rates that our customers and dealers would otherwise pay on financial products.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These subsidies were created to facilitate sales by the Equipment Operations, not to maximize Financial Services profitability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For this reason, the ROE goal for the subsidized business10%is the same regardless of the business cycle and is based on the implied after-tax cost of equity for Financial Services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Analysis shows that our threshold ROE goal of 10% represents upper quartile performance as compared to other financial institutions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The remaining Financial Services offerings are referred to as the non-subsidized business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The objective of the non- subsidized business is to efficiently utilize equity in order to earn a profitable return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consequently, this business has more traditional (and progressively more challenging) goals for threshold, target, and maximum ROE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee establishes goal levels based on benchmarking against ROEs attained by similar financial services businesses with similar debt-to-equity leverages, and by evaluating cost of equity financial models.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The threshold goal equals the implied after-tax cost of equity for Financial Services; the target and maximum ROE goals are set at progressively higher levels to encourage management and employees to efficiently utilize equity relative o industry norms and market conditions while facilitating sales by the Equipment Operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ROE goals of 13% at target and 16% at maximum represent an even greater level of stretch such that the difficulty attain target payouts is rigorous.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We regularly review the ROE of other financial institutions to ensure the appropriate level of stretch.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ROE goals are weighted based on the actual mix of subsidized versus non-subsidized business in a fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee approved the following ROE goals at the beginning of fiscal 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fiscal 2016 ROE Goals       Subsidized business          Non-subsidized business          Weighted Goals % of Business                                 66% 34% Maximum 16% 12% Target 10% 13% 11% Threshold 10% 10%

sentences.text: REVISED PERFORMANCE METRICS STARTING FISCAL 2017 In response to the say-on-pay vote outcomes and discussions with stockholders that followed, the Committee added two financial metrics net sales & revenue and net incometo the STI calculation for senior executives starting in fiscal 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee selected these metrics to tie annual incentive compensation to measures of our financial performance that are both meaningful and readily accessible to our stockholders and to reflect the importance of near-term financial execution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Moreover, basing annual incentive awards on a larger set of metrics ensures that executives take a comprehensive view of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will set target goals for net sales & revenue and net income at the beginning of each fiscal year based upon input from management regarding our expected performance in the upcoming year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As shown in the chart below, the goal for a target payout for each metric will match the number established in our annual operating budget forecastwhat we call the Original Budget.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: net sales & revenue that falls more than 10% below target, and net income that falls more than 15% below target, will result in no payout for those metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Conversely, net sales & revenue that exceeds target by at least 10%, and net income that exceeds target by at least 15%, will result in a maximum (200%) payout for those metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The metric spread for net income is wider because there are more factors that affect net income than there are for net sales & revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mid-Term Incentive (MTI)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MTI is a long-term cash award based on Deeres performance against ambitious goals for Shareholder Value Added (SVA) over a three-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SHAREHOLDER VALUE ADDED PERFORMANCE METRIC
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MTI plan is designed to motivate executives and other salaried employees to consistently create lasting value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To that end, since the MTI plan was first implemented, the performance metric has been Deeres SVA, which essentially measures earnings in excess of our cost of capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SVA was selected as the MTI performance metric because the Committee believes Deere should:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: earn, at a minimum, its weighted average cost of capital each year
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ensure that investments in capital and research and development earn their cost of capital
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ensure that acquisitions do not deteriorate stockholder value
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 47      DEERE & COMPANY          2017 PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation Direct Compensation Elements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Put another way, we believe Deere can realize sustainable improvement in SVA through a combination of revenue growth and high returns on invested capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SVA incorporates both of these concepts, and therefore serves as a barometer of long-term value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SVA is measured on an enterprise-wide level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the MTI plan encourages teamwork across all of our business units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How do we know it works?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal years 1994 through 2003 (the ten years before we implemented the MTI plan), accumulated SVA was negative $1.4 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the ten most recent fiscal years, accumulated SVA rose to $17.8 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This demonstrates that management has become adept at investing for the future while still delivering consistent stockholder returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We demonstrate how SVA is calculated in Appendix B, Deere & Company Reconciliation of Non-GAAP Measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MODIFICATION OF AWARDS BASED ON RELATIVE TSR
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In an effort to further align executive compensation with stockholder interests, the Committee added a relative TSR modifier to potential MTI payouts for our NEOs and certain other executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Starting with the performance period that began in fiscal 2015, we compare Deeres TSR for the performance period to TSR for the S&P Industrial Sector during the same time frame.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee chose the S&P Industrial Sector as a benchmark because it is an independently selected comparator group that includes a majority of our peer group companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This index is also used to measure relative performance for PSUs under our long-term incentive plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If Deeres TSR is at or below the 25th percentile of the index, the final MTI payout for our senior executives will be reduced by 25%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If Deeres TSR is between the 25th and 50th percentiles, the final MTI payout for our senior executives will be reduced by up to 25%, as shown in the graph below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The TSR modifier ensures that senior executives will not get the full MTI award unless Deeres TSR is at least at the median of the index.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is no upside for outperforming the 50th percentile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSR MODIFIER FOR MTI PAYMENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THREE-YEAR PERFORMANCE PERIODS The Committee approved three-year performance periods for MTI awards to emphasize the importance of consistent, sustained operating performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe employees are motivated to achieve consistently strong SVA results because, as we illustrate below under Historical Accumulated SVA, MTI Goals and MTI Payouts, each year affects award calculations in three separate rolling performance periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether positive or negative, SVA results for each year become part of the MTI award calculation for that year and the next two years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consequently, negative SVA in one year can offset positive SVA in another.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A single year of strong performance will not result in a high MTI payout if it follows one or two years of weak performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Conversely, MTI payouts will not necessarily be low after a year of weak performance if results in the two preceding years were strong.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 48      DEERE & COMPANY          2017 PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation Direct Compensation Elements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SETTING SVA GOALS Each year, two principles guide the Committee in fixing the accumulated maximum SVA goal for the next three-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: First, the goal for a maximum payout reflects return on invested capital performance in the top 25% relative to our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Second, the goal for a maximum payout is calculated based on estimated enterprise SVA at mid-cycle sales levels (described above under Performance Metrics for STI) for the first year of the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We cannot confidently forecast SVA for the second and third years of the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, we assume a compounded 7% annual growth rate (a number that corresponds to Deeres historical sales growth rate) for each of those remaining two years to arrive at a cumulative three-year SVA goal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once set, the goal is a fixed amount for the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As mentioned above, the maximum SVA goal represents top quartile invested capital performance, which is an aggressive stretch under normal business conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the target SVA goal is set at half of that amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A threshold MTI award for the performance period that just ended required $1 million of accumulated SVA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The threshold accumulated SVA goal was raised to $5 million starting with the performance period that began in fiscal 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The threshold goal was increased to avoid nominal payouts to eligible participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chart below details the threshold, target, and maximum accumulated SVA goals for each performance period that includes fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SVA goals grew significantly more challenging for the performance periods ending in 2016 and 2017: sales volumes for agricultural equipment increased in recent years, which led to a substantial increase in mid-cycle sales and increased expectations for SVA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the recent business downturn has become part of the business cycle, mid-cycle volumes have decreased resulting in a lower mid-cycle SVA for the performance period ending in 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the SVA goals have decreased, the same level of goal rigor exists due to the downturn in business conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SVA goals have increased 273% since the MTI plan was introduced in 2004 (a compounded annual growth rate of 14%).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SVA Goals for MTI Fiscal2014 through Fiscal 2016      Fiscal2015 through Fiscal 2017      Fiscal2016 through Fiscal 2018 Threshold SVA Required for Payout $1 million $5 million $5 million SVA Goal for Target Payout $3,605 million $4,495 million $4,200 million SVA Goal for Maximum Payout $7,210 million $8,990 million $8,400 million

sentences.text: APPROVAL OF LTI AWARD VALUES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee established LTI grants for the NEOs based on the following criteria: level of responsibility, individual performance, current market practice, peer group data, and the number of shares available under the Omnibus Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards granted in previous years are not a factor in determining the current years LTI award; nor is potential accumulated wealth.

sentences.text: At the first Committee meeting of each fiscal year, after consideration of peer group data on median values for long-term incentives, the Committee approves a dollar value for a base-level LTI award and the mix of awards to be delivered.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant price for all LTI awards prior to February 25, 2015 is the average of the high and low common stock price on the grant date as reported on the NYSE.

sentences.text: For awards made thereafter, the grant price is the closing price of Deere common stock on the NYSE on the grant date.

sentences.text: As has been the practice for several years, the Committee can increase (up to 20%) or decrease (down to $0) an individual NEOs base- level award to distinguish that executives performance, deliver a particular LTI value, or reflect other adjustments as the Committee deems appropriate.

sentences.text: Summary of Direct Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes each pay element included in Direct Compensation is consistent with our compensation philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews Direct Compensation for the NEOs in the aggregate (excluding the CEO) as well as for each NEO individually, and compares this compensation to the market position data of our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This market position data takes into account the level of responsibility (including the level of sales volume) for each NEOs respective operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A key element of these individual performance evaluations is a careful analysis of each NEOs collaboration and contribution to the success of a high-performing team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thus, while the market data for each position is a factor in reviewing Direct Compensation, the Committee also considers individual fulfillment of duties, teamwork, development, time in position, experience, and internal equity among NEOs (other than the CEO).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee recognizes individual performance through adjustments to base salary and LTI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 54      DEERE & COMPANY          2017 PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation Direct Compensation Elements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Direct Compensation for the CEO is higher than for the other NEOs due to the CEOs breadth of executive and operating responsibilities for the entire global enterprise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee does not target CEO compensation as a certain multiple of the compensation of the other NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The relationship between the CEOs compensation and that of the other NEOs is influenced by our organizational structure, which does not currently include a chief operating officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ratio of Mr. Allens Direct Compensation to that of the other NEOs is generally comparable to that found among the companies in our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Compensation Matters
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RULES RELATED TO STOCK OWNERSHIP, HOLDING REQUIREMENTS, AND ANTI-HEDGING AND ANTI- PLEDGING POLICIES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEOs are required to hold a certain amount of Deere stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO is expected to hold stock equivalent to 5 times base salary (a level that will rise to 6 times base salary next year), and the other NEOs are expected to hold stock equivalent to 3.5 times base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These ownership levels must be achieved within five years of the date the NEO is first appointed as CEO or as an executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEOs who have not achieved the requisite ownership level may not transfer any of the stock they acquire through our equity incentive plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only vested RSUs and any common stock held personally by an NEO are included in determining whether the applicable ownership requirement has been met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once an NEO achieves the appropriate ownership level, the number of shares held at that time becomes that individuals fixed stock ownership requirement for three years, even if base salary increases or Deeres stock price decreases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other than Mr. Kalathur and Mr. May, who were first appointed senior officers in September, 2012, each NEO has achieved stockholdings in excess of the applicable multiple as of the date of this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Insider Trading Policy precludes all directors and employees, including our NEOs, and their related persons from engaging in short sales of Deeres stock or trading in instruments designed to hedge against or offset price declines by any Deere securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Insider Trading Policy also prohibits our directors and officers from holding Deere stock in margin accounts or pledging Deere stock as collateral for loans or other obligations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LIMITATIONS ON DEDUCTIBILITY OF COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code generally limits to $1 million the U.S. federal income tax deductibility of compensation paid in one year to a companys CEO or any of its three next-highest-paid executive officers (other than its Chief Financial Officer).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based compensation is not subject to this limit on deductibility so long as such compensation meets certain requirements, including stockholder approval of material terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee strives to provide the NEOs with incentive compensation programs that will preserve the tax deductibility of compensation paid by Deere, to the extent reasonably practicable and consistent with Deeres other compensation objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes, however, that stockholder interests are best served by not restricting the Committees discretion and flexibility in structuring compensation programs, even though such programs may result in non-deductible compensation expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RECOUPMENT OF PREVIOUSLY PAID INCENTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deeres Executive Incentive Compensation Recoupment Policy authorizes the Committee to determine whether to require recoupment o cash and equity incentive compensation paid to or deferred by certain executives under certain conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the policy, the Committee may require recoupment if the Committee determines an executive received incentive compensation that was artificially inflated because the executive engaged in misconduct that:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: contributed to the need for a restatement of all or a portion of Deeres financial statements filed with the SEC; o
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: contributed to an incorrect calculation of operating metrics that are used to determine incentive plan payouts
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is closely monitoring the proposed rules and rule amendments issued by the SEC to implement provisions of the Dodd- Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act relating to recoupment of incentive-based compensation and will amend the Recoupment Policy if necessary when the final rules are adopted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation Indirect Compensation Elements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Indirect Compensation Elements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Perquisites
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We offer our NEOs various perquisites that the Committee believes are reasonable in order to remain competitive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These perquisites, which are described in footnote (6) to the Fiscal 2016 Summary Compensation Table, constitute a small percentage of the NEOs total compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee conducts an annual review of the perquisites offered to the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the items listed in footnote (6), NEOs, as well as other selected employees, are provided indoor parking and access to Deere-sponsored skyboxes at local venues for personal use when not occupied for business purposes, both at no incremental cost to Deere.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board requires the CEO to use company-owned aircraft for all business and personal travel because the ability to travel safely and efficiently provides substantial benefits that justify the cost.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The geographic location of Deeres headquarters in the Midwest, outside of a major metropolitan area, makes personal and business travel challenging.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Moreover, traveling by company aircraft allows the CEO to conduct business confidentially while in transit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Personal use of company aircraft by other NEOs is minimal and must be approved by the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has limited the CEOs annual personal usage of company aircraft to approximately 100 hours.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All NEOs are covered by the same defined benefit pension plans, which include the same plan terms as apply to most qualifying U.S. salaried employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also maintain two additional defined benefit pension plans in which NEOs may participate: the Senior Supplementary Pension Benefit Plan (the Senior Supplementary Plan) and the John Deere Supplemental Pension Benefit Plan (the Deere Supplemental Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The defined benefit pension plans have compensation limits imposed by the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Senior Supplementary Plan provides participants with the same benefit they would have received without those limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This avoids the relative disadvantage that participants would experience compared to other qualified plan participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Deere Supplemental Plan is designed to reward career service at Deere above a specified grade level by utilizing a formula that takes into account only years of service above that grade level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the defined benefit plans serve as important retention tools, provide a level of competitive income upon retirement, and reward long-term employment and service as an officer of Deere.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the fact that the Senior Supplementary and Deere Supplemental Plans are unfunded (with benefit payments under these plans being made out of the general assets of Deere) and therefore at-risk (if Deere were to seek bankruptcy protection), creates a strong incentive for the NEOs to minimize risks that could jeopardize Deeres long-term financial health.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional information, see the Fiscal 2016 Pension Benefits Table, along with the accompanying narrative and footnotes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also maintain a tax-qualified defined contribution plan, the John Deere Savings and Investment Plan (SIP), which is available to most of our U.S. employees, including the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We make matching contributions to participant SIP accounts on up to six percent of an employees pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The actual amount of the company match varies based on two factors: the STI results for the most recently completed fiscal year (see the Fiscal 2016 Performance Results for STI section above), and the pension option in which the employee participates (see the narrative preceding the Fiscal 2016 Pension Benefits Table).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table illustrates Deeres match for calendar 2016, which is reported for our NEOs under the All Other Compensation column of the Fiscal 2016 Summary Compensation Table:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Contemporary Option match on first 2% of eligible earnings:      300%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Contemporary Option match on next 4% of eligible earnings: 100%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Compensation Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also maintain certain deferred compensation plans that provide the NEOs with longer-term savings opportunities on a tax-efficient basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similar deferred compensation benefits are commonly offered by companies with which we compete for talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of November 1, 2015 for the Defined Contribution Restoration Plan and as of November 1, 2016 for the Deferred Plan, the investment options now parallel the investment options offered under our 401(k) plan (with certain limited exceptions).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Funds deferred prior to these effective dates may remain invested under the previous options, although participants also may move these funds into the new options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, participants may change investment options at any time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These changes effectively ensure that participants cannot earn above-market interest on new deferrals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See the Nonqualified Deferred Compensation section below for additional details.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Potential Payments upon Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deeres Change in Control Severance Program (the CIC Program) covers certain executives, including each of the NEOs, and is intended to facilitate continuity of management in the event of a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes the CIC Program:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: encourages executives to act in the best interests of stockholders when evaluating transactions that, without a change in control arrangement, could be personally detrimental
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: keeps executives focused on running the business in the face of real or rumored transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: protects Deeres value by retaining key talent despite potential corporate changes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: protects Deeres value after a change in control by including restrictive covenants (such as non-compete provisions) and a general release of claims in favor of Deere
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: helps Deere attract and retain executives as a competitive practice
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information, see Fiscal 2016 Potential Payments upon Change in Control and the corresponding table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Potential Post-Employment Payments
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deeres various plans and policies provide payments to NEOs upon certain types of employment terminations that are not related to a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These events and amounts are explained in the section under Executive Compensation Tables entitled Fiscal 2016 Potential Payments upon Termination of Employment Other than Following a Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Assessment of Compensation Policies and Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As shown in the adjacent diagram, management conducted a comprehensive risk assessment of Deeres compensation policies and practices, as we have done each year since 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The inquiries in the risk assessment questionnaire focus on: pay-for-performance comparison against our peer group; balance of compensation components; program design and pay leverage; program governance; and mitigating factors that offset program risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Convened a Risk Assessment Team comprising management personnel representing relevant areas of oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on its most recent review, the Risk Assessment Team concluded that Deeres compensation policies and practices do not create risks that are reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee, along with its independent compensation consultant, reviewed the risk assessment and concurred with that conclusion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes the following key factors support the Risk Assessment Teams conclusion:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Completed an inventory of Deeres compensation programs globally for both executive and non-executive employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the performance metrics for our STI and MTI incentive plans are based on enterprise publicly reported metrics with only minor adjustments and, therefore, are not easily susceptible to manipulation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the metrics for our STI and MTI compensation (and the related potential payouts) are capped to reduce the risk that executives might be motivated to attain excessively high stretch goals in order to maximize payouts
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Updated our existing detailed risk assessment questionnaire to take account of any relevant changes in our compensation structure or philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Deere maintains stock ownership requirements that are designed to motivate our management team to focus on Deeres long-term sustainable growth, and a Recoupment Policy designed to prevent misconduct relating to financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Applied the updated questionnaire to the compensation programs that, due to their size, potential payout, or structure, could potentially have a material adverse effect on Deere.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pension Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEOs are eligible to participate in pension plans that provide benefits based on years of service and pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pension benefits are provided under a qualified defined benefit pension plan called the John Deere Pension Plan for Salaried Employees (the Salaried Plan) and two nonqualified pension plans called the Senior Supplementary Pension Benefit Plan (the Senior Supplementary Plan) and the John Deere Supplemental Pension Benefit Plan (the Deere Supplemental Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 1996, we introduced a new pension option under the Salaried Plan known as the Contemporary Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At that time, participants could elect to remain in the existing Salaried Plan option, known as the Traditional Option, or convert to the new Contemporary Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New employees hired between January 1, 1997, and October 31, 2015, automatically participated in the Contemporary Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For new employees hired on or after November 1, 2015, pension benefits under the Salaried Plan are calculated based on a cash balance methodology instead of the Traditional or Contemporary Option formulas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of the NEOs participate in the Traditional or cash balance plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation Executive Compensation Tables

sentences.text: SALARIED PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Salaried Plan is a qualified plan subject to certain IRS limitations on benefits and is subject to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deere makes contributions to, and benefits are paid from, a tax-exempt pension trust.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pension benefits provided by he Salaried Plan under the Contemporary Option are summarized below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Contemporary Option, Career Average Pay is used in computing retirement benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Career Average Pay is calculated using salary plus STI (up to IRS limits).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For participants hired before January 1, 1997, the transition to Career Average Pay includes salary and STI awards from 1992 until retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deere makes contributions to the 401(k) retirement savings accounts of salaried employees participating in this option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The formula for calculating benefits under the Contemporary Option is:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Career Average Pay   Years of Service     1.5%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Early retirement eligibility under the Contemporary Option is the earlier of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) age 55 with ten or more years of service; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) age 65 with five or more years of service
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pension payments are reduced by 4% for each year the employee is under the unreduced benefits age upon retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Mack is the only NEO currently eligible to retire early with reduced benefits under the Contemporary Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligibility to retire with unreduced benefits under the Contemporary Option occurs at age 67 for all participating employees who were hired on or after January 1, 1997.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For participants hired before this date, the eligibility age to retire with unreduced benefits is based on years of service as of January 1, 1997, and ranges from ages 60 to 67.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Allen is the only NEO currently eligible to retire with unreduced benefits under the Contemporary Option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SENIOR SUPPLEMENTARY PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SENIOR SUPPLEMENTARY PLAN The Senior Supplementary Plan is an unfunded, nonqualified excess defined benefit plan that provides additional pension benefits in an amount comparable to those the participant would have received under the Salaried Plan in the absence of IRS limitations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefit payments for the Senior Supplementary Plan are made from the assets of Deere and are at-risk in the event Deere seeks bankruptcy protection.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Senior Supplementary Plan uses the same formula as the Salaried Plan to calculate the benefit payable, except that eligible earnings include only amounts above qualified plan limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DEERE SUPPLEMENTAL PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Deere Supplemental Plan is an unfunded, nonqualified supplemental retirement plan for certain employees, including all the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefit payments for the Deere Supplemental Plan are made from the assets of Deere and are at-risk in the event Deere seeks bankruptcy protection.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Deere Supplemental Plan was closed to new participants effective November 1, 2015, although benefits will continue to accrue for employees who were already participating in the plan as of that date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The formula for calculating benefits is:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The actuarial present value is calculated by estimating expected future payments starting at an assumed retirement age, weighting the estimated payments by the estimated probability of surviving to each post-retirement age, and discounting the weighted payments at an assumed discount rate to reflect the time value of money.

sentences.text: The actuarial present value represents an estimate of the amount that, if invested today at the discount rate, would be sufficient on an average basis to provide estimated future payments based on the current accumulated benefit.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The DCRP is designed to allow executives participating in our Contemporary Option to defer employee contributions and receive employer matching contributions on up to 6% of eligible earnings that are otherwise limited by tax regulations.

sentences.text: For DCRP purposes, eligible earnings include base salary, STI, and commission compensation.

sentences.text: (None of the NEOs receive commission compensation.)

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This plan is unfunded and participant accounts are at-risk in the event Deere seeks bankruptcy protection.

sentences.text: The CIC Program includes a double trigger approach, under which participants will receive severance benefits only if both a change in control and qualifying termination occur.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A qualifying termination is either:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deeres termination of an executives employment within the six months preceding or the 24 months following a change in control for reasons other than death, disability, or cause (defined as an executives willful and continued nonperformance of duties after written demand; willful conduct that is demonstrably and materially injurious to Deere; or illegal activity)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An executives termination of his or her own employment for good reason (defined as material reductions or alterations in an executives authority, duties, or responsibilities; change in office location of at least 50 miles from the executives current residence; material reductions in an executives participation in certain Deere compensation plans;or certain other breaches of the covenants in the CIC Program) within 24 months following a change in control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CIC Program defines the following as change in control events:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any person, as defined in the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (with certain exceptions), acquires 30% or more of Deeres voting securities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a majority of Deeres directors are replaced without the approval of at least two-thirds of the existing directors or directors previously approved by the then-existing directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any merger or business combination of Deere and another company, unless the outstanding voting securities of Deere prior to the transaction continue to represent at least 60% of the voting securities of the new company;or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deere is completely liquidated or all, or substantially all, of Deeres assets are sold or disposed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits provided under the CIC program and other benefit plans are described in the footnotes to the table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although not reflected in the table, the CIC Program provides that Deere will pay the executives reasonable legal fees and expenses if the executive must enforce the program terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the CIC Program, the executives agree:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) not to disclose or use for their own purposes confidential and proprietary Deere information; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) for a period of two years following termination of employment, not to induce Deere employees to leave Deere or to interfere with Deeres business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Omnibus Plan, the MTI plan, and the Deferred Plan each contain change in control provisions that may trigger payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Omnibus Plan, unless the Board or the Committee determines otherwise, and regardless of whether the employee is terminated, all then-outstanding equity awards that were granted before February 24, 2010, would vest and restriction periods would end upon a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All outstanding RSUs would be cashed out as of the date of the change in control and the executive would have the right to exercise all outstanding options.

sentences.text: For awards made under the Omnibus Plan on and after February 24, 2010, the foregoing provisions will apply only if there is both a change in control and a qualifying termination.

sentences.text: The MTI plan provides for payment upon a change in control based on actual performance results to date for all performance periods then in progress.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Deferred Plan, in the event of certain changes in control, the Committee may elect to terminate the plan within twelve months and distribute all account balances, or the Committee may decide to keep the Deferred Plan in effect and modify it to reflect the impact of the change in control.

sentences.text: Item 3  Advisory Vote on the Frequency of Future Advisory Votes on Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to Section 951 of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, at least once every six years, Deere is required to submit for stockholder vote a non-binding resolution to determine whether the advisory stockholder vote on executive compensation should occur every one, two, or three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders last approved an annual advisory vote on executive compensation in 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After careful consideration of the appropriate frequency and after receiving feedback from stockholders on the issue during our outreach efforts, the Board believes that submitting the advisory vote on executive compensation to stockholders on an annual basis is appropriate for Deere and its stockholders at this time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DEERES BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECOMMENDS A VOTE FOR A FREQUENCY OF 1 YEAR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxy card provides stockholders with four choices (every one, two, or three years, or abstain).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders are not voting to approve or disapprove the Boards recommendation.

sentences.text: Effect of Proposal
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The frequency vote is non-binding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder approval of a one, two, or three-year frequency vote will not require Deere to implement an advisory vote on executive compensation every one, two, or three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The final decision on the frequency of the advisory vote on executive compensation remains with the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board values our stockholders opinions as expressed through their votes and other communications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the resolution is non-binding, the Board and the Compensation Committee will carefully consider the outcome of the frequency vote and other communications from stockholders when making future decisions regarding the frequency of say-on-pay votes.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Review Committee is directly responsible for the appointment, oversight, compensation, and retention of the independent registered public accounting firm that audits Deeres financial statements and our internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Review Committee has approved the selection of Deloitte & Touche LLP to serve as the independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal 2017.

sentences.text: The Audit Review Committee believes that the appointment of Deloitte & Touche as the independent registered public accounting firm for Deere is in the best interests of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Review Committee and the Board are requesting that stockholders ratify this appointment as a means of soliciting stockholders opinions and as a matter of good corporate practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The current Deloitte & Touche lead auditor for Deere, Doug Alkema, was appointed in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The affirmative vote of a majority of the shares present in person or by proxy and entitled to vote at the meeting is required to ratify the selection of Deloitte & Touche LLP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the stockholders do not ratify the selection, the Audit Review Committee will consider any information submitted by the stockholders in connection with the selection of the independent registered public accounting firm for the next fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if the selection is ratified, the Audit Review Committee, in its discretion, may direct the appointment of a different independent registered public accounting firm at any time during the year if the Audit Review Committee believes such a change would be in the best interests of Deere and its stockholders.

sentences.text: Audit Review Committee Report
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS: The Audit Review Committee is responsible for assisting the Board of Directors in fulfilling its oversight responsibilities pertaining to the accounting, auditing, and financial reporting processes of Deere.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management is responsible for establishing and maintaining Deeres internal control over financial reporting and for preparing financial statements in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Review Committee is directly responsible for the appointment, oversight, compensation, and retention of Deloitte & Touche LLP, the independent registered public accounting firm for Deere.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deloitte & Touche LLP is responsible for performing an independent audit of Deeres annual consolidated financial statements and internal control over financial reporting and expressing opinions on
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the conformity of Deeres financial statements with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) Deeres internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All members of the Audit Review Committee are financially literate under the applicable NYSE rules, and two members of the Audit Review Committee  Mr. Page and Ms. Smith  are audit committee financial experts within the meaning of that term as defined by the Securities and Exchange Commission in Regulation S-K under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Review Committee has a written charter describing its responsibilities, which has been approved by the Board of Directors and is available on Deeres website at www.deere.com/corpgov.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of the Audit Review Committee rely on the information provided and the representations made to them by management, which has primary responsibility for establishing and maintaining appropriate internal control over financial reporting and for Deeres financial statements and reports, and by the independent registered public accounting firm, which is responsible for performing an audit in accordance with Standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States) (PCAOB) and expressing opinions on
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the conformity of Deeres financial statements with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) Deeres internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this context, we have reviewed and discussed with management Deeres audited financial statements as of and for the fiscal year ended October 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have discussed with Deloitte & Touche LLP the matters required to be discussed by PCAOB Auditing Standard No. 16, Communications with Audit Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have received and reviewed the written disclosures and the letter from Deloitte & Touche LLP required by applicable requirements of the PCAOB regarding the independent registered public accounting firms communications with the Audit Review Committee concerning independence and have discussed with them their independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have concluded that Deloitte & Touche LLPs provision of audit and non-audit services to Deere is compatible with their independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On at least a quarterly basis, the Audit Review Committee meets in executive session with Deere management and the Deere internal audit staff, as well as separately with Deloitte & Touche LLP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the reviews and discussions referred to above and exercising our business judgment, we recommend to the Board of Directors that the financial statements referred to above be included in Deeres Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended October 31, 2016, for filing with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have selected Deloitte & Touche LLP as Deeres independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal 2017 and have approved submitting the selection of the independent registered public accounting firm for ratification by the stockholders.

sentences.text: We expect the following proposal to be presented by stockholders at the annual meeting, although if the proposal is not properly presented by or on behalf of the proponents, it will not be voted on.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following SEC rules, other than minor formatting changes, we are reprinting the proposal and supporting statement as it was submitted to us, and we take no responsibility for its content.

sentences.text: Upon request to our Corporate Secretary at the address listed under the 2018 Stockholder Proposals and Nominations section below, we will provide the names, addresses, and shareholdings of the sponsors and any cosponsors of these proposals.

sentences.text: Stockholder ProposalRight to Act by Written Consent
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 1 Right to Act by Written Consent
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED: Stockholders request that our board of directors undertake such steps as may be necessary to permit written consent by stockholders entitled to cast the minimum number of votes that would be necessary to authorize the action at a meeting at which all stockholders entitled to vote thereon were present and voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This written consent is to be consistent with applicable law and consistent with giving stockholders the fullest power to act by written consent consistent with applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proposal topic won majority stockholder support at 13 major companies in a single year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This included 67%-support at both Allstate and Sprint.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hundreds of major companies enable stockholder action by written consent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Taking action by written consent in lieu of a meeting is a means stockholders can use to raise important matters outside the normal annual meeting cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A stockholder right to act by written consent and to call a special meeting are 2 complimentary ways to bring an important matter to the attention of both management and stockholders outside the annual meeting cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Taking action by written consent saves the expense of holding a special stockholder meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deere stockholders have a particular need for the right to call a special meeting because it is more difficult than necessary for Deere stockholders to call a special meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Delaware law considers it reasonable for 10% of stockholder to call a special meeting  yet our company made the threshold 25% of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please vote to enhance stockholder value: Right to Act by Written Consent  Proposal 1
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deeres Response  Statement of Opposition to Stockholder Proposal
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE BOARD RECOMMENDS THAT YOU VOTE AGAINST THE PROPOSAL TO ADOPT WRITTEN CONSENT FOR THE FOLLOWING REASONS:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 80      DEERE & COMPANY          2017 PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Proposals Item 5  Stockholder Proposal
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has given careful consideration to this proposal and has concluded for the reasons described below that the adoption of this resolution is unnecessary and is not in the best interests of Deere and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has demonstrated consistently its commitment to sound principles of corporate governance, working to ensure that its practices protect and further the interests of Deeres stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following are a few examples of corporate governance best practices that the company has adopted to foster stockholder participation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annual election of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: no supermajority voting provisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: special meeting rights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: proxy access rights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: stockholder engagement (see Stockholder Outreach on page 31)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the Boards view, the transparency and fairness of the annual or special meeting process supports all stockholders interests in severa ways that the written consent process does not.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deeres current practices are designed to ensure that prior notice and an opportunity to be heard precede stockholder votes, so that all stockholders have a meaningful and structured opportunity to consider proposed actions and express their views by voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In contrast, this proposal would enable a limited group of stockholders to act in favor of their own proposed actions, without a meeting and without ever providing notice to other Deere stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actions taken by written consent could deprive many stockholders of the critical opportunity to assess, discuss, deliberate and vote on pending actions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Permitting stockholder action by written consent could also lead to substantial confusion to stockholders and disruption to the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the proposal, multiple groups of stockholders would be able to solicit written consents at any time on a range of issues, some of which may be duplicative or conflicting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This disordered state of corporate affairs would thus impose significant administrative and financial burdens on the company, while providing little or no corresponding benefit to stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Moreover, the proposal is unnecessary in light of Deeres existing corporate governance practices, including the ability of stockholders to call special meetings and the proxy access by-law adopted by the Board in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, any matter that either Deere or its stockholders wish to present for a vote must be presented at an annual or special meeting of all stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deeres by-laws permit holders of at least 25% of the outstanding shares the power to call a special meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the context of an annual or special meeting of stockholders, all Deere stockholders have the opportunity to express views on proposed actions and to participate in the meeting and stockholder vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The safeguards in place around the ability to act by a special or annual meeting promote and protect stockholders interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In contrast, the proposal would allow stockholders to use the written consent procedure at any time and as frequently as they chose to act on a range of matters without a meeting, potentially without notice to all stockholders and without an opportunity for fair discussion among all stockholders on the merits of the proposed action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board does not believe that the proposal calling for action by written consent is necessary or in the best interests of stockholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR THE REASONS STATED, DEERES BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECOMMENDS A VOTE AGAINST THE PROPOSAL TO ADOPT A PROXY ACCESS BY-LAW.

sentences.text: Why am I receiving this Proxy Statement?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are receiving this Proxy Statement because you owned shares of Deere common stock at the close of business on December 30, 2016, which entitles you to vote, either in person at the Annual Meeting or by proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement describes the matters on which you are asked to vote so you can make an informed decision.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement, together with our Annual Report for the fiscal year ended October 31, 2016, a proxy card, and a voter instruction card, will be mailed, or can be accessed online, on or about January 13, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We refer to these documents collectively as Deeres Proxy Solicitation Materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is Notice and Access and why did Deere elect to use it?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We make the Proxy Solicitation Materials available to stockholders electronically under the Notice and Access regulations of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (the SEC).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, most of our stockholders receive a Notice of Electronic Availability (Notice) instead of a full set of Proxy Solicitation Materials in the mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice explains how to access and review the Proxy Solicitation Materials and how to vote online.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this method of delivery expedites distribution of Proxy Solicitation Materials and also allows us to conserve natural resources and reduce the costs of printing and distributing these materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received a Notice but would prefer to get printed copies of the Proxy Solicitation Materials in the mail, please follow the instructions in the Notice for requesting such materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How do I vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can vote either in person at the Annual Meeting or by proxy without attending the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To ensure a quorum, we urge you to vote by proxy even if you plan to attend.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you attend the meeting and vote in person, that vote will override your proxy vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To vote your shares, follow the instructions in the Notice, voter instruction form, or proxy card.
